Nicki Minaj returns with 'The Pinkprint'

Jeffrey Lee Puckett, jpuckett@courier-journal.com 9:52 a.m. EST December 15, 2014

Nicki Minaj, 'The Pinkprint'(Photo: Promotional)

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Nicki Minaj is making a statement with the name of her new album, "The Pinkprint," which is a nod to Jay-Z's landmark 2001 release, "The Blueprint." That album is considered one of hip-hop's finest and was a massive commerical and critical success.

Minaj brings some firepower with her in the form of Mrs. Jay-Z, Beyonc, along with Ariana Grande, Meek Mill and Chris Brown. But the first single, "Anaconda," is a ridiculous trifle about Minaj's infamous gluteus maximus, emphasis on maximus.

COURIER-JOURNAL

More new music releases for week of Dec. 16

Jeffrey Lee Puckett can be reached at (502) 582-4160, jpuckett@courier-journal.com and on Twitter, @JLeePuckett.
